data.title: Bulimia Banquet Flipside Records
data.meta_description:
Party My Colon by Bulimia Banquet Flipside Records, released 01 December 2020

1. Loadhead Destructor
2. Bobo
3. Chew a Cyst/To Exist
4. I Make You
5. Seek Al
6. Plan of Deception
7. No More
8. Spanky
9. Hippyfoot
10. Allansan
11. Survival
12. Lemon Lime Hermaphrodite
13. Rectum Hunt
14. Scatcore

Party My Colon was recorded in August of 1989 at Westbeach Recorders. It was produced by Bill Stevenson and Stephen Egerton for Flipside Records. Members featured included Jula Bell, Al Hansford, Jason Greenwood, & Mia Ferraro. Extra backup vox by Ingrid Baumgart and Loren Dobsen.

In the '80's and 90's Bulimia Banquet appeared on the covers of a multitude of punk fanzines, and were featured on many punk rock comps. Most notable was the cover of Southern California’s Flipside magazine. The band prided themselves on their aggressive and extremely fast paced playing style. Their sound was like no other bands at the time, and they quickly gained notoriety as a band to watch. Their songs were social commentaries on everything from societal problems, gender inequities, and their own humorous and personal glamorization of the mundane. They were non-conformists, who made sure to not take themselves too seriously. 

Bulimia Banquet’s live shows were a head spinning discordant to chordal delight, peppered with heavy chunky guitars, timely self deprecating humor, and the occasional sing-a-ble punk anthemic lyrics, all mixed in at a fiery pace. They were tight and powerful, and exhilarating to watch live. 

Jula Bell was famous for her aggressive “sea shanty” punk bass style, her versatile banshee pipes (Bell was an Opera Major in college), and for not using a pick when she played bass. Al Hansford was renowned for his diabolical experimental demon guitar and home made guitars, amps, and pedals. Ingrid Baumgart was respected for her straight ahead metal, punk, and speedcore influenced bombastic rhythm guitar and vicious growly voice. Even though Jason Greenwood was only 14 years old when he joined the band, he was already an incredibly accomplished drummer. His drumming style included some unwieldingly ferocious hardcore drumming mixed with some very unique backwards beats that he added in without pause. Dez Cadena was a welcome addition to the group. He lent his legendary vocals and super solid ass-kicking guitar mastery (as well as infinite punk rock credibility) to the mix. Later guitarist Mia Ferarro sang some soulful harmonies, and laid down some beefy and guitar licks. The final lineup included veteran guitar legend Steve (Dro’)Drojensky, who shredded some fat chords for a brutally solid punk rock guitar rhythm. Travis Johnson, who was also in the final lineup, was a human drum metronome who threw down some speedy, effortless, and intricate solid skin beatings. 

Bulimia Banquet toured the US and Europe in the pre cell phone era and played a variety of punk venues. They played across the globe with hardcore bands, art punk bands, pop punk bands, riot grrrl bands, metal bands, speedcore bands, and thrashmetal bands. 

The band members included Jula Bell (Bobsled, Marc Spitz Freeystyle, Nip Drivers, Miss Derringer) on Bass/ Vox, Al Hansford (The Imperial Butt Wizards, The Omlits, Fur on Rubber, Bathsalt Zombie$) on Guitar/Vox, Ingrid Baumgart (Razebrae, Malicious Grind, Ingrate Souls )Guitar/Vox, Jason Greenwood (PUI, TVTV$, Punk Rock Vatos) Drums/Vox, Dez Cadena (Black Flag, DC3, Flag,The Misfits) Guitar/Vox, Travis Johnson (Final Conflict, HR Band, Dick Dale, The Dickies) Drums/Vox, Steve (Dro’) Drojensky (Angry Samoans, Aggression, Moral Decay, RF7, Bobsled, Fifi) Guitar/BG Vox, and Mia Ferraro (Hole, Bobsled, Spoon, Sapphic Musk)Guitar/Vox. Earlier drummers for the band included Greg Cameron (Marc Spitz Freestyle, Swa, October Faction, The Chemical People, The Jeff Dahl Band, The Punk Rock Vatos) Drums, Nick Passiglia (Nip Drivers) on drums, and Jennifer Finch (L7, The Shocker, Other Star People) on guitar and B.G. Vox. 

Bulimia Banquet put out two albums with Flipside Records. The first album, Eat Fats Die Young was produced by John Girdler, Al Hansford, Pat Smear (The Germs, Nirvana), and Don Bolles (The Germs and Celebrity Skin) at Pacifica Studios and West Beach Recorders. Party My Colon was produced by Bill Stevenson (Descendents, Black Flag, All) and Stephan Egerton (Descendents, All) at Westbeach Recorders. They also put out a split single with Piece of Mind (Curse me/Replete), as well as a multitude of comps including Flipside Vinyl Fanzine #3, a cover of Alice Cooper’s Under My Wheels for Welcome to Our Nightmare by TripleX Records (w/background vox by Dee Detroit of UXA), A cover of Hot Rod Lincoln for a comp (w/vocals by Marc Heathfield of Short Dogs Grow, and a cover of The Ramone’s Endless Vacation for Gabba Gabba Hey (Triple X). 

Bulimia Banquet made a few videos for Curse me and Dine or Die, and are featured in Lisa Apramian’s and Courtney Love’s Not Bad for a Girl (the quintessential Riot Grrrl movie).

Bulimia Banquet’s first show was with Firehose at Bebop Records 8/14/86 in Reseda California and their last show was 9/19/92 at Als Bar. They had two reunion shows since 1992. They played with the original lineup at the Anarchy Library in 2005. Their second round of reunions were 7/8/11 at The Redwood Bar and Grill in Downtown Los Angeles and 7/9/11 at Mr. T’s Bowl in Highland Park. 

Tragically, Jason Greenwood, the original drummer for Bulimia Banquet passed away in June of 2018 at 46 years old. The other members have all gone on to play with a plethora of amazing bands.
data.text:
1.

Loadhead Destructor 01:42

Loadhead Destructor Bought a beard at the drugstore North's a springin' loadies gettin' outta hand. Singeing their moustaches They are sucking off the bland. Loadhead Destructor Bought a beard at the drugstore Molson's muscle rejects living two faced loadie lies. Lampshades on their asses and crusty bloodshot eyes. Resin teeth don't spook me They're miller high life free. What really busts my bridge is suburban sasquatch mentality.

2.

Bobo 02:12

Here I stand at the center of infinity Crying joyful/painless tears Once a creature now a child I have lived one million years Here I kneel at the center of infinity Reliving birth Once a creature bears a child It's place is taken on the earth As the earth is my mother Thus I am hers Like a needle stuck into her heart pulling the thread of another. Here I lay at the center of infinity Creaking stature, world of pain Once a creature dies, a child is born unto the soil again.

3.

Chew a cyst Suck my fist You're on my list little witch Why can't you be the person you wanna be? Your constant pretensions they hammer relentlessly.

4.

I Make You 01:50

I wish I could find thoughts in my head I wish I could be in touch with my mind I wish I could care if I lived or died I wish I could die so you would understand I make you...My life $avings You make me...My life $avings 2x I wish I could know, know how you feel I wish I could do what you want me to I wish I could be something I'm not I wish I could I wish I could I make you...My life $avings You make me...My life $avings 2x I wish I could see you with my eyes I wish I could feel your love in my heart I wish I could hold your head in my arms I wish I could hold your heart in my hands I make you...My life $avings You make me...My life $avings 2x I make you...

5.

Seek Al 02:10

He's no louse He's just loose Ain't no slouch He'll walk your pooch! He's Al! Our pal! Mishap of the South Bay! Sense of wit Cracks your bones Guitar picks Cthulu tones He's Al! Our pal! Mishap of the South bay! Smokey eyes but he can see SEEK AL Spends his life so secretly SEEK AL Trusty as a friend can be SEEK AL Sappy as a willow tree SEEK AL SEEK AL SEEK AL SEEK AL He's the guy to save your pants SEEK AL Worldly in all circumstance SEEK AL Cutting the law or building a fence SEEK AL Specialty is home improvements He's no louse He's just loose Ain't no slouch He'll walk your pooch He's Al! Our pal! Mishap of the South Bay! Sense of Wit Cracks your bones Guitar picks Cthulu tones He's Al! Our pal! Mishap! Of the South Bay! Smokey eyes but he can see SEEK AL Spends his time so secretly SEEK AL Trusty as a friend can be Sappy as a willow tree

6.

Plan of Deception 01:28

My plan of deception A desperate decision To regret the inconvenience Of shallow importance So I took down the picture Aborted the mission Bid farewell to the heroes And sacrificed the child

7.

No More 03:48

No more for me I'm strong not weak No more for me Give up my misery No more for me You're not my cup of tea No more for me Give up my misery Do you want to sleep in the dirt with me? You're my pickle-pantin'-poppa long legged chickadee. Do you want to wake in the mud with me? I'm the undertoad squawking at a quarter to three. Do you wanna be in a tidepool with me? You'll kiss my sticky lips in the slimy algae.

8.

Spanky 00:49

Take a hit Seeing some shit Don't know what to do with it. I am Spanky On LSD 4x Going too fast Going too slow I don't know I don't know. I am Spanky On LSD 4x Time is going much too fast Seeing the future What about the past? My mind is going much too fast I don't know how long it's gonna last I am Spanky On LSD 5x

9.

Hippyfoot 02:13

Be careful where you put Your blackened hippy foot Walk on hot cement and hardened excrement Scrimfoot Scrimfoot Scrimfoot Hippyfoot Callouses and corns On your feet so worn Get your spokes true Borrow my right shoe Scrimfoot Scrimfoot Scrimfoot Hippyfoot Use his Allen wrench Sniff his manly stench Wears a nipple ring So he can really sing. Scrimfoot Scrimfoot Scrimfoot Hippyfoot He eats macaroons Writes the bitchin' tunes When we celebrate He will always be late Dirty Itchy Scratchy Hippy foot

10.

Allansan 01:44

11.

Survival 01:22

I won't stick a needle in myself I won't throw a rope around my neck I won't kick the bucket in your bed I won't pop my brain inside your head Cuz I want to walk in the sun And remember I want to the be the only one So now I'm pushing along I'm a back street kid, look what I did Trying to be your only one So now I hate parties, gatherings all the social stool - social shit Harboring and breeding hostility and insecurity The armpit of youth stalking revolution And if I'm not there with you It must be because of nuclear war or something Some fuckin' disaster Because where else could I exist Is that all I'm left with? It can't be to this Have I let myself get that deranged After all these years of self reform? And I want to walk in the sun And remember I want to the be the only one So now I'm pushing along I'm a back street kid, look what I did Trying to be your only one And don't you forget it! Survival. I can stand alone without your name. Survival. Makes me. Makes you. All the same. All the same. All the same!

12.

Lemon Lime Hermaphrodite 02:52

My lemonlime hermaphrodite You lord them sideways ...and you thank them for their time I just might My lemonlime hermaphrodite Yea yea Cthulhu Fatogen Yea yea using your noggin Yea yea in a tobaggan Yea yea Kutulu phatoggan The future is past it has already happened (and) anything beyond this are results of the future All Morpheus and vague insecurities made congruities Dangerous Ideologies that you left Closer realities other seem to regret I just might My lemon lime hermaphrodite Other ordinary proverbs contradict to knack verve While grazing the obtuse Intersecting the absurd Yea yea Cthulhu Fatogen Yea yea using your noggin Yea yea in a tobaggan Yea yea Cthulhu!

13.

Rectum hunt Sucking butt Nicotine slut When you suck butt Big fatty gut Too much Pizza Hut You look like a slut- big cherry butt

14.
